titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Samuel Austin Worcester (1798-1859) was a missionary in the 1830s to the Cherokee Nation under the American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Mission, translator of the Bible, and a printer. In 1831, Worcester was imprisoned by Georgia authorities for violating a state law by residing in the Cherokee nation without a permit by the governor.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of two manuscript journals of Rev. Samuel A. Worcester, 1831-1833 and 1835-1841. Journals describe his trial and imprisonment, and discuss travels, addresses to Cherokees, preaching, prayer meetings, and visits.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
